items.sentence: Tom spends all his time thinking about Mary.
Tom spent the night in an old hunting shack.
Tom started studying French three years ago.
I\'m sure Tom knows enough French to get by.
I\'m sure Tom will be in Boston next Monday.
I\'m sure it must have been very disturbing.
I\'m the one who went to Australia with Tom.
You\'re one of Tom\'s students, aren\'t you?
Tom says he thinks Mary isn\'t going to win.
Tom says he\'s planning to do that tomorrow.
Tom should\'ve called the police right away.
Tom should\'ve sung the song Mary requested.
Tom shouldn\'t have told Mary what John did.
That isn\'t likely to happen in my lifetime.
The country\'s economy is about to collapse.
Tom\'s family is happy that he\'s back home.
Amsterdam is the capital of the Netherlands.
As soon as she saw me, she burst out crying.
Both Tom and Mary have never been to Boston.
Did you have a good meal at that restaurant?
Tom said that he could make it to the party.
Tom tried to stop Mary from talking to John.
Tom couldn\'t hold onto the rope any longer.
Tom couldn\'t imagine his life without Mary.
Tom couldn\'t remember where he put his pen.
Tom couldn\'t stand the suspense any longer.
Tom couldn\'t think of anything else to try.
Tom couldn\'t understand anything Mary said.
I can\'t fix it. It\'ll have to be replaced.
I can\'t go with you because I\'m very busy.
If you need an umbrella, I can lend you one.
If you need me to do something, just say so.
If you won a million yen, what would you do?
In order to do that, you have to take risks.
In the heat of the moment, Tom slapped Mary.
When was the last time you had a girlfriend?
When was the last time you had a steady job?
When was the last time you used a toll road?
When was the last time you washed your hair?
I\'ll have Tom bring up some dinner for you.
I\'ll make you wish you had never been born.
I\'ll never forget what happened here today.
I\'ll never forget what happened that night.
I\'ll see to the arrangements for the party.
I\'ll teach you everything you need to know.
I haven\'t had this much fun in a long time.
I haven\'t laughed like that in a long time.
I just didn\'t want to go to work yesterday.
I just don\'t want to be disappointed again.
Tom asked Mary if she wanted to go with him.
